qas.question: To what were the first kings of Rome associated?
To what group of deities did Lucius Tarquinius Priscus  establish a temple?
Where was the temple to the triad gods established?
What organization did Servius Tullius found?
The removal of whom marked the beginning of the Roman Republic?

context: Each of Rome's legendary or semi-legendary kings was associated with one or more <a0_0>religious institutions<a0_0/> still known to the later Republic. Tullus Hostilius and Ancus Marcius instituted the fetial priests. The first "outsider" Etruscan king, Lucius Tarquinius Priscus, founded a <a2_0>Capitoline<a2_0/> temple to the triad <a1_0>Jupiter, Juno and Minerva<a1_0/> which served as the model for the highest official cult throughout the Roman world. The benevolent, divinely fathered Servius Tullius established the <a3_0>Latin League,<a3_0/> its Aventine Temple to Diana, and the Compitalia to mark his social reforms. Servius Tullius was murdered and succeeded by the arrogant <a4_0>Tarquinius Superbus<a4_0/>, whose expulsion marked the beginning of Rome as a republic with annually elected magistrates.
